intro: Salsola kali var. strobilifera, commonly known as Russian thistle or goatweed, is a flowering plant in the family Amaranthaceae. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, characterized by its succulent stems and leaves. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in dense, cone-like structures called fascicles. It is well adapted to harsh conditions, with deep root systems that allow it to survive in poor soils and extreme temperatures. Due to its invasive nature, it is often considered a weed in agricultural and natural areas.
